text: Michael McClure (October 20, 1932 - May 4, 2020) was an American poet, playwright, critic, songwriter, and novelist. He became known as one of the five poets (including Allen Ginsberg) who read at the famous San Francisco Six Gallery reading in 1955. He was one of the inspirations for Jack Kerouac's The Dharma Bums. He soon became a key member of the Beat Generation. A character named "Pat McLear" is inspired by him in Kerouac's Big Sur. McClure was born in Marysville, Kansas. He studied at Municipal University of Wichita, the University of Arizona and San Francisco State College. He spent his career in San Francisco. McClure died of stroke-related problems on May 4, 2020 in Oakland, California, aged 87.Michael McClure, famed Beat poet who helped launch the SF Renaissance, dead at 87 == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American poets Category:American playwrights Category:American songwriters Category:American novelists Category:Writers from Kansas Category:Writers from San Francisco
